intro: Quinchamalium chilense var. procumbens, commonly known as the Chilean quinchamalium, is a flowering plant native to southern Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and temperate regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
